
# Overview {.unnumbered}

This is the course website for **OH8004 Knowledge Synthesis in Occupational and Public Health** in the School of Occupational and Public Health, Toronto Metropolitan University.

The course calendar description for **OH8004** is as follows:

> This course will cover structured methods of comprehensively synthesizing and reviewing research evidence. Detailed guidance will be provided on the design and conduct of systematic reviews and meta-analysis in occupational and public health. Students will be required to identify an individual occupational or public health review topic of key relevance to their thesis, and will conduct a structured literature review on this topic.

For the most recent **course outline** and all announcements, please visit the D2L website for this course. This website will be used to review core content, examples, and exercises during in-class sessions.

This e-book was prepared using [Quarto](https://quarto.org/docs/books/) in [RStudio (Posit)](https://posit.co/). Additionally, the book uses [WebR](https://docs.r-wasm.org/webr/latest/), implemented using [quarto-webr](https://quarto-webr.thecoatlessprofessor.com/), in certain chapters to implement data management and meta-analysis in your web browser with interactive coding.
